definition: to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: She is rumoured to have eloped with a priest.
sentences.chinese: 谣传他和一个牧师私奔了。

sentences.english: In fact the rumor is without foundation.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，这个谣传没有根据。

sentences.english: The pay was not as much as was rumored, Huang said.
sentences.chinese: 黄说，薪水并没有谣传的那么高。

sentences.english: There were rumours starting, from theIsraelites.
sentences.chinese: 以色列军开始互相谣传。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, you are OK also these message regard as bru it or it is gossip.
sentences.chinese: 不过，你也可以将这些消息看做谣传或是道听途说。

sentences.english: Bill Gates is rumored to be an Aspie.
sentences.chinese: 谣传比尔盖茨就是个亚斯伯格症患者。

sentences.english: It is rumored that this old house is home to a number of long-haired ghosts.
sentences.chinese: 谣传这栋古宅是一些长发鬼聚集的地方。

sentences.english: Rumour has it that McCulloch's thought they were buying the much more spectacular Tower Bridge.
sentences.chinese: 有谣传说石油公司想买的原是更加壮观的塔桥。

sentences.english: Rumour has it that something roars at the night in this house.
sentences.chinese: 据谣传这所房间每天夜里有什么东西吼叫。

sentences.english: I’ve heard a whisper that old Bill’s going to lose his job next month.
sentences.chinese: 谣传说老比尔下个月要丢差事了。

sentences.english: Rumor spread the prices would go up, many peopel stampeded into a wave of panic buying.
sentences.chinese: 谣传物价要上涨，很多人卷入了抢购的风潮中。

sentences.english: There has been a bunch of blathering about Wikileaks in the last few weeks.
sentences.chinese: 过去几周对“危机解密”有很多谣传。

sentences.english: Rumors of an Apple netbook and/or a touchscreen Apple notebook have been bandied about for what seems like ages.
sentences.chinese: 苹果上网本，或者带触摸屏的笔记本已经谣传了很久。

sentences.english: She is rumoured to have been married in England.
sentences.chinese: 谣传她已经在英国结婚。

sentences.english: Urban myths abound about the birds being able to disembowel a man with their claws.
sentences.chinese: 城市里流传着一些谣传说鹤鸵能用爪子挖出人的内脏。

sentences.english: Or the latest rumored release date of…
sentences.chinese: 竣工日期也可能是最近谣传的某年月日。

definition: to spread falsehoods/to increasingly distort the truth/to pile errors on top of errors (idiom)
lit. wind from an empty cave (idiom)/fig. unfounded (story)/baseless (claim)
unfounded rumor/to pass on a mistaken belief to others
widely spread/widely rumored/stories abound/(sb's exploits are) widely circulated
lit. without wind there cannot be waves (idiom); there must be a reason/no smoke without fire
